channel.title: My new cell phone
channel.description:
Alright, I bought a cell-phone from Telus a few weeks ago. My plan is free weekend and early evening calling and unlimited messaging. I have pay as you go so I get my features online. I recently bought web browsing. I know it costs alot, But I bought it just to get ring tones. (It was 7.50 to access the internet, So I was like what the hell? I have 250 $ on my account anyway) After I bought the feature, They told me to wait 15 minutes for the feature apply. It's been 2 hours and it doesn't work. When I go to my browser, It displays "403: Forbidden" like I had before I bought my phone (Without the browsing feature). Does anyone have any idea what could be wrong? I don't want to contact costumer service because It's the third time I did today about other issues. Anyway, Any page I load gives me the 403 error. Does anyone have any idea what's wrong?
Thanks in advance.
p.s My phone is a Samsung SPH-M540 "Slyde".

item.title: My new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:7, topic:286752”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=379216.msg2852897#msg2852897 date=1246649073]
Nokia N97 for the win.
[/quote]I was gonna get that. Too bad my contract doesn’t get me a phone till next year.[/quote]
It’s so expensive.

item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

$250? Mine is more like $70, and thats a family plan.

Read full topic

item.title: My new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

You might need to connect to a different server to receive your “new” mobile internet. Try and find the menu with your networks services (On my samsung its under applications; yours is probably different) and look for something like “get settings” and you will recieve a couple of texts about your settings. Then when you open them theres an option about saving the settings. Then once you’ve saved all the settings from all the texts you should be able to browse teh internets.

Read full topic

item.title: My new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

Thanks, I’ve tried going to google and It’s still giving me the 403: Forbidden error. : I’ve tried to contact costumer support and they said they can’t help me out

Read full topic

item.title: My new cell phone
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Customer support gets paid to talk to you, and get paid extra in commissions for what they sell. So go ahead and call again

For the web thing, are you sure it’s the right site? If you’re on pay as you go, there should be a web browsing fee if you don’t have a plan anyway (on Rogers I know it’s 5 cents per page I think, but I also have unlimited web browsing for $7 a month)…

Try going to Google, just to make sure it’s not whatever the site it’s trying to load.

Read full topic
